Episodes.Title: The Sixth Extinction (2)
Episodes.Plot: While Scully travels to Africa to piece together the meaning of the symbols on the spaceship beached on the Ivory Coast, Mulder is imprisoned by his own frenetic brain activity. He manages to get a message to Skinner who finds Kritschgau, and together they try to understand what is happening to Mulder before it is too late.
Episodes.GuestStars: Warren Sweeney, Mari Weiss, Abdoulaye N'Gom, Anthony Okungbowa, Michael Ensign, Jo Nell Kennedy, Conrad Roberts

Episodes.Title: The Sixth Extinction II: Amor Fati (3)
Episodes.Plot: Scully frantically searches for a way to help her ailing partner without having anyone to turn to for help, while a catatonic Mulder's dreams lead him away from his mission and the X-Files to a place which he believes is a better life.
Episodes.GuestStars: Henry Schwartz, Megan Leitch, Brian George, Arlene Pileggi, Anthony Anselmi, Fritz Greve, Warren Sweeney, Andrew Cavarno, Steven Cavarno, Martin Grey, Rebecca Toolan

Episodes.Title: Hungry
Episodes.Plot: A monster who feeds on human brain matter tries to lead a normal life, but he soon cannot control his feelings of hunger.
Episodes.GuestStars: Chad E. Donella, Mark Pelligrino, Judith Hoag, Lois Foraker, Bill Lee Brown, Chasen Hampton, Kerry Zook, Steve Kiziak, Kevin Porter, Susan Slome

Episodes.Title: Millennium
Episodes.Plot: As the year 2000 draws closer, the agents are up against a man from the Millennium Group who believes that he can bring about the end of the world on the 31st of December if he resurrects four former members from the dead. To gain more insight into the group and its practices, Mulder and Scully enlist criminal profiler Frank Black to assist them in the investigation.
Episodes.GuestStars: Dick Clark, Monnae Michaell, Octavia Spencer, Romy Walthall, Stephen Ramsey, Eulan Middlebrooks, Michael Dempsey, Lance Henriksen, Holmes Osborne, Colby French, William Forward, Brittany Tiplady, Marilyn McIntyre

Episodes.Title: Rush
Episodes.Plot: A young man who has gained the ability to move faster than the eye can see begins to use his new power to kill his enemies, including the local sheriff who happens to be his father.
Episodes.GuestStars: Rodney Scott, Scott Cooper, Nicki Lynn Aycox, Ann Dowd, Tom Bower, Les Lannom, Christopher Wynne, Rachel Winfree

Episodes.Title: The Goldberg Variation
Episodes.Plot: Mulder and Scully get caught in a real-life Rube Goldberg device when they meet Henry Weems, who just may be the luckiest man on Earth - except everyone around him doesn't seem to be that lucky.
Episodes.GuestStars: Willie Garson, Alyson Reed, Ramy Zada, Tony Longo, Nicholas Worth, Dom Magwili, Marshall Manesh, Ernie Lee Banks, Chip Fogelman, Dominique DiPrima, Bobby Moynahan, Shia LaBeouf

Episodes.Title: Orison
Episodes.Plot: Reverend Orison hopes to save Donnie Pfaster's soul by helping him break out of prison, but Donnie immediately plans to go after the victim that once escaped him... Scully.
Episodes.GuestStars: Scott Wilson, Nick Chinlund, Steve Rankin, Emilio Rivera, Lisa Kushell, Rick Cramer, Tara Buck, Irene Muzzy, Eric Buker

Episodes.Title: The Amazing Maleeni
Episodes.Plot: When a small-time magician performs a trick where it appears that he turns his head all the way around but is then found in his van dead with his head neatly sawed off, Mulder and Scully suspect he was murdered and get caught up in an intricate scheme planned by two magicians trying to rob a bank.
Episodes.Writer: Vince Gilligan, John Shiban, Frank Spotnitz
Episodes.GuestStars: Ricky Jay, Jonathan Levit, Robert LaSardo, Jim Maniaci, Rick Marzan, Mark Chaet, Dennis Keiffer, Dan Rice, Sherri Howard, J. David, Steven Barr, Adam Vernier

Episodes.Title: Signs & Wonders
Episodes.Plot: Snakes are killing the unrighteous, but Mulder and Scully doubt that this is a case of divine intervention.
Episodes.GuestStars: Randy Oglesby, Tracy Middendorf, Michael Childers, Eric Nenninger, Beth Grant, Philip Lenkowsky, Clement E. Blake, Stevie Johnson, Phyllis Franklin, Dan Manning, Elyse Donalson, Donna May

Episodes.Title: Sein und Zeit (1)
Episodes.Plot: A young girl inexplicably disappears from her home, and Mulder requests the case even though it is a full FBI matter, not just an X-File. When Mulder takes some outrageous leaps to convince the girl's parents that she will be found, Scully fears that Mulder is becoming too personally involved with the case because of his sister's abduction.
Episodes.GuestStars: John Harnagel, Marie Chambers, John Bisom, Nancy Tiballi, Dylan Stjepovic, Mark Rolston, Rebecca Toolan, Shareen J. Mitchell, Megan Corletto, Spencer Garrett, Kim Darby, Martin Grey, Randall Bosley

Episodes.Title: Closure (2)
Episodes.Plot: After arresting the murderer of Amber-Lynn LaPierre and discovering a mass grave site containing the bodies of dozens of missing children, a man comes to Mulder and claims to have had visions of other victims who aren't buried at the site. Despite Scully's objections, he takes Mulder on a journey which reveals what truly happened to his sister.
Episodes.GuestStars: Patience Cleveland, Christopher Wynne, Ed Beechner, Megan Corletto, Nicholas Stratton, Fort Atkinson, Jeff Xander, Norman Smith, Anthony Heald, Stanley Anderson, Rebecca Toolan, Mimi Paley

Episodes.Title: X-COPS
Episodes.Plot: A Los Angeles police officer who is being filmed for the show COPS is attacked by a strange monster and Mulder and Scully are investigating the case. Scully is wary of having their faces put on national television but Mulder welcomes the publicity.
Episodes.GuestStars: Judson Mills, Dee Freeman, Perla Walter, J.W. Smith, Curtis C., Michael Maher, Tara Karsian, Lombardo Boyar, Maria Celedonio, John Michael Vaughn, Daniel Emmett, Frankie Ray, Solomon Eversol, Cheryl Comstock, Ron G

Episodes.Title: First Person Shooter
Episodes.Plot: The Lone Gunmen call Mulder and Scully to a virtual reality development lab where they learn that one of the program testers was killed inside the computer generated game environment by the digital image of a woman. Needing to get his yah-yah's, Mulder enters the game to fight the woman, but Scully must step in to save him.
Episodes.GuestStars: Krista Allen, Jamie Marsh, Constance Zimmer, Billy Ray Gallion, Ryan Todd, James Geralden, John Marrott, Christopher Ng, Michael Bower

Episodes.Title: Theef
Episodes.Plot: Mulder and Scully suspect that hexcraft is the source of threats against a doctor's family.
Episodes.Writer: Vince Gilligan, John Shiban, Frank Spotnitz
Episodes.GuestStars: Billy Drago, James Morrison, Kate McNeil, Cara Jedell, Tom Dahlgren, Sage Allen, Pamela Gordon, Michael Sidney, Matthew Sutherland, Dylan Kussman, Aaron Braxton, Leah Sanders, Mark Thompson

Episodes.Title: En Ami
Episodes.Plot: The Cigarette-Smoking Man offers to show Scully the cure for all diseases if she travels with him, but on one condition:  Mulder must not know about her trip.
Episodes.GuestStars: Timothy Landfield, Cory Parravano, Michael Canavan, Jacqueline Schultz, Thomas Roe, Tom Bailey, Michael Shamus Wiles, Louise Latham

Episodes.Title: Chimera
Episodes.Plot: As Mulder investigates a missing person case with a key feature being a menacing raven, he learns to enjoy the creature comforts of a well-tended home while Scully must tough it out on an uncomfortable stakeout.
Episodes.GuestStars: Wendy Schall, Charles Hoyes, Ashley Edner, Michelle Joyner, Gina Mastrogiacomo, F. William Parker, John Mese

Episodes.Title: all things
Episodes.Plot: A series of coincidences leads Scully to a married man she had an affair with during medical school but left him to protect his family.
Episodes.GuestStars: Colleen Flynn, Stacy Haiduk, Stephen Hornyak, Nicolas Surovy, Victoria Faerber, Carol Banker, Elayn Taylor, Cheryl White, Scott Vance

Episodes.Title: Brand X
Episodes.Plot: While protecting a man due to testify against the Morley cigarette company, Skinner is horrified when the witness dies mysteriously. What the agents soon discover is that a new brand of cigarette has a dangerous secret.
Episodes.GuestStars: Arthur Rosenberg, Ron Marasco, Pat Destro, Caryn West, Rick Deats, David Sawyer, Greg Poland, Matthew T. Wilson, Dennis Boutsikaris, Tobin Bell, Shannon O'Hurley, Richard Cox

Episodes.Title: Hollywood A.D.
Episodes.Plot: Mulder and Scully watch a movie with themselves as characters and are thoroughly disgusted at how they and their case are portrayed on the big screen. They recount how 18 months earlier they were followed around by a Hollywood producer while investigating a case concerning The Lazarus Bowl - a mythical piece of pottery reputed to have inscribed on it the words that Jesus Christ spoke when he raised Lazarus from the dead.
Episodes.GuestStars: Tim Roe, Barry K. Thomas, Tina M. Ameduri, Bill Millar, Tony Amendola, Garry Shandling, Téa Leoni, Harris Yulin, Wayne Federman, Paul Lieber, Chris Carter, David Alan Grier, Minnie Driver

Episodes.Title: Fight Club
Episodes.Plot: Mulder and Scully cross paths with two women who are identical and have followed each other across 17 states in the last three years, causing chaos and mayhem wherever they are.
Episodes.GuestStars: Randall Tex Cobb, Art Evans, Jack McGee, Gene LeBell, Kathy Griffin, Arlene Pileggi, Steve Kiziak, Cory Blevins, John O'Brien, Christopher Michael, Brian Chenoweth, Jim Hanna, Nicole Bush, Paul Hansen Kim, John Mac

Episodes.Title: Je Souhaite
Episodes.Plot: Mulder and Scully discover a genie in a rug who, after 500 years of granting wishes, has come to the conclusion that people are still as greedy and self-centered as they always have been, and she begins to corrupt the wishes she grants if they are not specific enough.
Episodes.GuestStars: Brett Bell, Paula Sorge, Will Sasso, Kevin Weisman, Paul Hayes

Episodes.Title: Requiem
Episodes.Plot: Mulder and Scully return to the town of their first X-Files investigation where a UFO has crashed in the forest. The Cigarette-Smoking Man arranges for Krycek to be released from prison in order for him to make contact with the aliens and begin rebuilding the "Project", while Scully's health appears to be taking a turn.
Episodes.GuestStars: Brian Thompson, Peter MacDissi, Grace Demontesquiou, Kelly Demontesquiou, Leon Russom, Andy Umberger, Sarah Koskoff, Gretchen Becker, Darin Cooper, Eddie Kaye Thomas, Judd Trichter, Grace and Kelly de Montesquio
